str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To enclose, shut in, make subject to. From sun and kleio; to shut together, i.e. Include or embrace in a common subjection to.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Willful unbelief, obstinacy, disobedience. From apeithes; disbelief.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
